item.description:
Scenario 1 - Display local and USD Amount and Cost fields on the Milestone page.

Given a project in IDS

and the user is on the  project related view

When the user clicks on the link of a project milestone

Then the system displays the Milestone page

and the system displays Milestone amount field with the sum of UnitSellingPriceLocal values of all eligible order products

and the system displays the Milestone amount USD field with the sum of UnitSellingPriceUSD values of all eligible order products

and the system displays the Milestone Cost field with the sum of SkuCostLocal values of all eligible order products

and the system displays the Milestone Cost USD field with the sum of SKUCostUSD values of all eligible order products. 



Scenario 2 - Calculate Milestone fields on the project creation

Given an order eligible for Project Creation

When the project is created  and the order is associated to the project milestone
then the system retrieves the order product lines with item class description that is marked as key on the project practice 
and the system sum up the product of the UnitSellingPriceLocal by the quantity of each line and populates the MILESTONE AMOUNT field
and the system sum up the product of the  UnitSellingPriceUSD by the quantity of each line and populates the MILESTONE AMOUNT USD field
and the system sum up the product of the SkuCostLocal by the quantity of each line and populates the MILESTONE COST field
and the system sum up the product of the SKUCostUSD by the quantity of each line and populates the MILESTONE COST USD field

Scenario 3 - Recalculate milestone fields  on order association
Given an order eligible to be associated to an existing project

When the order is associated to the project
and the order is associated to a milestone
then the system retrieves the order product lines  with item class description that is marked as key on the project practice
and the system updates the MILESTONE AMOUNT field by adding the product of UnitSellingPriceLocal by quantity  to the current amount
and the system updates the MILESTONE AMOUNT USD field by adding the product of UnitSellingPriceUSD by quantity to the current amount
and the system updates the MILESTONE COST field by adding the product of SkuCostLocal by quantity to the current amount
and the system updates the MILESTONE COST USD field by adding the product of  SkuCostUSD by quantity to the current amount

Scenario 4 - Recalculate milestone fields  on order association
Given an existing project with orders

When an order is unassociated of that project
then the system recalculates the amount and cost fields of the milestone by retrieving  the product lines of that order  with item class description that is marked as key on the project practice
and the system updates the MILESTONE AMOUNT field by subtracting the product of  UnitSellingPriceLocal by the quantity values to the current amount
and the system updates the MILESTONE  AMOUNT USD field by subtracting the product of  UnitSellingPriceUSD by the quantityvalues to the current amount
and the system updates the MILESTONE COST field by subtracting the product of  SkuCostLocal by the quantityvalues to the current amount
and the system updates the  MILESTONE COST USD field by subtracting the product of  SkuCostUSD by the quantityvalues to the current amount


Scenario 05 - Order association pending approval
Given an order eligible to be associated to an existing project

When the order is associated to the project
and the order falls under the approval queue
Then the system does not recalculate the milestone amount and cost fields

Scenario 06 - Credit Orders - Order association
Given a credit order eligible to be associated to an existing project

When the order is associated to the project

Then the system does not update the milestone amount field
and the system does not update the milestone amount USD field
and the system does not update the milestone cost field 
and the system does not update the milestone cost USD field 

Scenario 07 - Credit Orders - Order Unassociation

Given a project with credit orders 

When the credit order is unassociated 

Then the system does not update the milestone amount field
and the system does not update the milestone amount USD field
and the system does not update the milestone cost field 
and the system does not update the milestone cost USD field

item.description:
As a services business lead, I need the system to have the ability to calculate the complexity when the project is tied to sub-region so that I can make sure we can staff project managers with the right seniority level. 

Given a project is created in FinancialForce
When the system runs the project complexity calculation process 
and the project has region set to a State or Province (flag isState = true) 
Then the system calculates project threshold based on the country tied to the project region.

item.description:
As a services project manager, I need visibility on the as sold cost and revenue values both in local and corporate (usd) currency, so I do not need to manually convert myself. 

AC01: Update AS SOLD COST USD   due Order Association
Given an order matches an existing engagement
And order items match any existing child project
When the system runs the order grouping process
and the system creates AS SOLD Cost budget  from the order 
Then the AS SOLD COST Amount - USD value is rolled up to the As Sold Cost USD Field at the project level.

AC02: Update AS SOLD Revenue USD due Order Association
Given an order matches an existing engagement
And order items match any existing child project
When the system runs the order grouping process
and the system creates AS SOLD Revenue budget  from the order 
Then the AS SOLD Revenue Amount - USD value is rolled up to the As Sold Revenue USD Field at the project level.

item.description:
Given an order item is assigned to a project
and the order association is pending project manager approval
When the system rejects the approval request
and the system reprocess the order 
and the order item does not match any other Child Project Before Approval Phase under the same engagement
and regardless of the order item matching an existing child Project later Approval Phase 
Then the system creates a Child Project 
And the system associates the order items to the Child Project.

query.value: SELECT pse__Region__r.Name from pse__Proj__c where Id = '{{project_id_1}}'

item.description:
Given an order item is assigned to a project
and the order association is pending project manager approval
When the system rejects the approval request
and the system reprocess the order 
and the order item does not match any other Child Project Before Approval Phase under the same engagement
and regardless of the order item matching an existing child Project later Approval Phase 
Then the system creates a Child Project 
And the system associates the order items to the Child Project.

item.name: CONTACT 2 : POPULATE STATE AND COUNTRY (only reset value)

item.description:
As a services project support lead , I need the system to try to group rejected order products into other child projects so that I can avoid a high number of similar child projects created when similar rejected orders are rejected. 


AC 1: Order items does not match any other child project

Given an order item is assigned to a project
and the order association is pending project manager approval
When the system rejects the approval request
and the system reprocess the order 
and the order item does not match any other Child Project Before Approval Phase under the same engagement
and regardless of the order item matching an existing child Project later Approval Phase 
Then the system creates a Child Project 
And the system associates the order items to the Child Project.
AC 2: Order Item matching Child Project before Approval Phase (Before Execution) 
Given an order item is assigned to a project
and the order association is pending project manager approval
When the system rejects the approval request
and the system reprocess the order 
and the system find only one matching project not in Approval Phase
Then the system associates the order items to the project

AC 3: Order items matching multiple Child Projects
Given an order item is assigned to a project
and the order association is pending project manager approval
When the system rejects the approval request
and the system reprocess the order 
and the order item matches multiple projects before Approval Phase 
Then the system associates the order item to the most recent project.

SELECT Residency__c from pse__Proj__c where Id = '{{project_id_1}}'

item.description:
As a PSA Intake, I need the system automatically sets the Residency flag from the SKu to effort Mapping when the project is created so that I can proper identify the type of staffing is required for the project. 


Assumptions:
Either Standard or Custom Projects can be flag as Residency.
Any regular projects should display Residency flag
Residency flag will be set automatically only when project is created via Automated process
System will not update Residency flag on Order association/ disassociation process.

AC 01: Project Creation when Order has Residency flag 
Given a order is associated to an engagement
and the order has a mapping in the SKU to effort  table
and the mapping has Residency flag checked
and the order does not match the existing child project
When the system creates the project
Then the system checks the Residency flag to true

AC 02: Project Creation when Order does not have Residency flag 
Given a order is associated to an engagement
and the order has a mapping in the SKU to effort  table
and the mapping has Residency flag unchecked
and the order does not match the existing child project
When the system creates the project
Then the system checks the Residency flag to false

query.value: SELECT id, Service_Tower__c from OrderItem where Project__c = '{{project_id_2}}'

item.description:
Given an order item is assigned to a project
and the order association is pending project manager approval
When the system rejects the approval request
and the system reprocess the order 
and the order item does not match any other Child Project Before Approval Phase under the same engagement
and regardless of the order item matching an existing child Project later Approval Phase 
Then the system creates a Child Project 
And the system associates the order items to the Child Project.

As a services project support lead , I need the system to try to group rejected order products into other child projects so that I can avoid a high number of similar child projects created when similar rejected orders are rejected. 


AC 1: Order items does not match any other child project

Given an order item is assigned to a project
and the order association is pending project manager approval
When the system rejects the approval request
and the system reprocess the order 
and the order item does not match any other Child Project Before Approval Phase under the same engagement
and regardless of the order item matching an existing child Project later Approval Phase 
Then the system creates a Child Project 
And the system associates the order items to the Child Project.
AC 2: Order Item matching Child Project before Approval Phase (Before Execution) 
Given an order item is assigned to a project
and the order association is pending project manager approval
When the system rejects the approval request
and the system reprocess the order 
and the system find only one matching project not in Approval Phase
Then the system associates the order items to the project

AC 3: Order items matching multiple Child Projects
Given an order item is assigned to a project
and the order association is pending project manager approval
When the system rejects the approval request
and the system reprocess the order 
and the order item matches multiple projects before Approval Phase 
Then the system associates the order item to the most recent project.

item.description:
As a services project support lead , I need the system to try to group rejected order products into other child projects so that I can avoid a high number of similar child projects created when similar rejected orders are rejected. 


AC 1: Order items does not match any other child project

Given an order item is assigned to a project
and the order association is pending project manager approval
When the system rejects the approval request
and the system reprocess the order 
and the order item does not match any other Child Project Before Approval Phase under the same engagement
and regardless of the order item matching an existing child Project later Approval Phase 
Then the system creates a Child Project 
And the system associates the order items to the Child Project.
AC 2: Order Item matching Child Project before Approval Phase (Before Execution) 
Given an order item is assigned to a project
and the order association is pending project manager approval
When the system rejects the approval request
and the system reprocess the order 
and the system find only one matching project not in Approval Phase
Then the system associates the order items to the project

AC 3: Order items matching multiple Child Projects
Given an order item is assigned to a project
and the order association is pending project manager approval
When the system rejects the approval request
and the system reprocess the order 
and the order item matches multiple projects before Approval Phase 
Then the system associates the order item to the most recent project.

exec: pm.test("WO SKU Effort Mapping Entry containing Event Type as null must be 0", function () {

url.raw: {{url}}/services/data/v41.0/query/?q= SELECT Id, SKU_Effort_Mapping_Entry__r.Name__c, Event_Type__c from WO_SKU_Effort_Map__c where SKU_Effort_Mapping_Entry__c != null and SKU_Effort_Mapping_Entry__r.Name__c != 'PM Activities' and SKU_Effort_Mapping_Entry__r.Name__c != 'PM Time Entry' and WO_Record_Type__c = 'Installation Badge' and Event_Type__c = null

query.value: SELECT Id, SKU_Effort_Mapping_Entry__r.Name__c, Event_Type__c from WO_SKU_Effort_Map__c where SKU_Effort_Mapping_Entry__c != null and SKU_Effort_Mapping_Entry__r.Name__c != 'PM Activities' and SKU_Effort_Mapping_Entry__r.Name__c != 'PM Time Entry' and WO_Record_Type__c = 'Installation Badge' and Event_Type__c = null

item.description:
As a services business lead, I need a data script to setup event type field on the WO SKU to effort Mapping table so that I can make sure that the event is sent over to Click when a resource is requested. 

Given a record on the WO SKU Effort Mapping Entry table
and the record has the WO Record Type field set to Installation badge
When the script runs

item.description:
As a project manager,  I need to have event type field auto populated when the service appointment is created so that  I do need to manually enter the information. 

AC 1: Work Order Installation Badge Creation 
Given a child project exists in FinancialForce
and the project has order product with entries on the WO SKU To effort Mapping
and the WO Record type field is set to Installation badge in the entry
when the user moves to the phase matching the Create On Phase field from the entry
Then the system creates a work order with record Type set to "Installation-Badge".
and the system creates the  service appointment for the work order
and the system populates the event type field with the task name value with the event type field from the WO SKU to effort Mapping entry.
